metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2037 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The cpio_safer_name_suffix function in util.c in cpio 2.11 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a craftedcpio file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2037` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpio - 2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cpio package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2').
